column4: I've just installed ubuntu yesterday and cannot get any videos to play in VLC or movie player- the application just closes.  Any ideas?
do your menus do neat things like fade?
here's the deal: there's an issue with the default ATI setup and video playback.  the good news is that there is a really easy fix.
Sounds good to me- should I browse around for a fix or is it easy for you to relate it here?
I was googling it up to make sure :)
ok, what you need to do is add the line Option "AccelMethod" "EXA" as shown https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/xserver-xorg-video-ati/+bug/269357 < here
once that's done, restart X, and watch your videos :)
I'm sorry- where in this file do I add the line?  In a new section?
no no, under the Identifier "Configured Video Device"
I have Section "Device", should I use that or make a new one?
